title: He hasn't finished yet: achievements and challenges in the work of Michael Mann
abstract:
Over the past thirty years, Michael Mann has become established as\ud
one of the world’s leading social theorists. Mann’s contributions to a\ud
range of disciplines and to a number of important issues – state\ud
formation, empire and what he terms the ‘dark side’ of democracy\ud
and modernity – place him on a par with leading figures in both\ud
classical and contemporary social theory. At the same time, Mann’s\ud
engagement with International Relations and his broader discussion\ud
with world history remain incomplete for three main reasons: Mann\ud
underplays the role of agency in the formation of the modern world;\ud
under-theorises the international dimensions of world historical\ud
development; and fails consistently to relate normative concerns to\ud
his overall enterprise
